name: argoslabs.api.rest

meta_info.author: Jerry Chae
classifiers: Topic :: Change :: Log :: Unittest for Windows
meta_info.description: ARGOS-LABS RPA plugin module for RESTful API

description: This is a plugin for RESTful API using HTTPie

options.name: help
options.title: help
options.help: Print usage

options.name: infile
options.title: infile
options.help: for input stream file (default is nothing, "-" means stdin)

options.name: outfile
options.title: outfile
options.help: for output stream file (default is stdout)

options.name: errfile
options.title: errfile
options.help: for error stream file (default is stderr)

options.name: statfile
options.title: statfile
options.help: for status (default is stdout)

options.name: logfile
options.title: logfile
options.help: for log file to logging, default is argoslabs.api.rest.log (500K size, rotate 4)

options.name: loglevel
options.title: loglevel
options.help: loglevel for logfile (default is "info")

options.name: verbose
options.title: verbose
options.help: verbose logging (-v, -vv, -vvv ... more detail log)

options.name: dumpspec
options.title: dumpspec
options.help: dump arguments spec as json or yaml format

options.name: file
options.title: file
options.help: file list to use in --req-item for @@index (1-based)

options.name: req_item
options.title: req_item
options.help:
REQUEST_ITEM
      Optional key-value pairs to be included in the request. The separator used
      determines the type:

      ':' HTTP headers:
          Referer:http://httpie.org  Cookie:foo=foo  User-Agent:bacon/1.0
      '==' URL parameters to be appended to the request URI:
          search==httpie
      '=' Data fields to be serialized into a JSON object (with --json, -j)
          or form data (with --form, -f):
          name=HTTPie  language=Python  description='CLI HTTP client'
      ':=' Non-string JSON data fields (only with --json, -j):
          awesome:=true  amount:=42  colors:='["red", "green", "blue"]'
      '@' Form file fields (only with --form, -f):
          cs@~/Documents/CV.pdf
      '=@' A data field like '=', but takes a file path and embeds its content:
           essay=@Documents/essay.txt
      ':=@' A raw JSON field like ':=', but takes a file path and embeds its content:
          package:=@./package.json
      '@@' Form file fields (only with --form, -f): 
          index of --file list (1-based)
          cs@@1
      '=@@' A data field like '=', but takes a file path and embeds its content:
          index of --file list (1-based)
          essay=@@2
      ':=@@' A raw JSON field like ':=', but takes a file path and embeds its content:
          package:=@@1

      You can use a backslash to escape a colliding separator in the field name:
          field-name-with\:colon=value

options.name: form
options.title: form
options.help:
--form, -f
      Data items from the command line are serialized as form fields.
      The Content-Type is set to application/x-www-form-urlencoded (if not
      specified). The presence of any file fields results in a
      multipart/form-data request.

options.name: session
options.title: session
options.help:
--session SESSION_NAME_OR_PATH
      Create, or reuse and update a session. Within a session, custom headers,
      auth credential, as well as any cookies sent by the server persist between
      requests.

options.name: session_read_only
options.title: session_read_only
options.help:
--session-read-only SESSION_NAME_OR_PATH
      Create or read a session without updating it form the request/response
      exchange.

options.name: auth_type
options.title: auth_type
options.help:
--auth-type {api-auth,aws,basic,digest,edgegrid,hawk,hmac,jwt,negotiate,ntlm,oauth1}, 
      -A {api-auth,aws,basic,digest,edgegrid,hawk,hmac,jwt,negotiate,ntlm,oauth1}
      The authentication mechanism to be used. Defaults to "basic".

      "basic": Basic HTTP auth
      "digest": Digest HTTP auth
      "hawk": Hawk Auth (provided by https://github.com/mozilla-services/requests-hawk)
      "oauth1": OAuth 1.0a 2-legged (provided by https://github.com/httpie/httpie-oauth)
      "ntlm": NTLM auth (provided by https://github.com/httpie/httpie-ntlm)
      "negotiate": SPNEGO auth (provided by https://github.com/ndzou/httpie-negotiate)
      "jwt": JWT auth (provided by https://github.com/teracyhq/httpie-jwt-auth)
        Set the right format for JWT auth request
      "hmac": HMAC token auth (provided by https://github.com/guardian/httpie-hmac-auth)
        Sign requests using a HMAC authentication method like AWS
      "edgegrid": EdgeGrid auth (provided by https://github.com/akamai/httpie-edgegrid)
      "aws": AWS auth (provided by https://github.com/httpie/httpie-aws-auth)
      "api-auth": ApiAuth auth (provided by https://github.com/pd/httpie-api-auth)
        Sign requests using the ApiAuth authentication method

options.name: auth
options.title: auth
options.help:
--auth USER[:PASS], -a USER[:PASS]
      If only the username is provided (-a username), HTTPie will prompt
      for the password.

options.name: proxy
options.title: proxy
options.help:
--proxy PROTOCOL:PROXY_URL
      String mapping protocol to the URL of the proxy
      (e.g. http:http://foo.bar:3128). You can specify multiple proxies with
      different protocols.

options.name: follow
options.title: follow
options.help:
--follow, -F
      Follow 30x Location redirects.

options.name: verify
options.title: verify
options.help:
--verify VERIFY
      Set to "no" (or "false") to skip checking the host's SSL certificate.
      Defaults to "yes" ("true"). You can also pass the path to a CA_BUNDLE file
      for private certs. (Or you can set the REQUESTS_CA_BUNDLE environment
      variable instead.)

options.name: ssl
options.title: ssl
options.help:
--ssl {ssl2.3,tls1,tls1.1,tls1.2}
      The desired protocol version to use. This will default to
      SSL v2.3 which will negotiate the highest protocol that both
      the server and your installation of OpenSSL support. Available protocols
      may vary depending on OpenSSL installation (only the supported ones
      are shown here).

options.name: cert
options.title: cert
options.help:
--cert CERT
      You can specify a local cert to use as client side SSL certificate.v
      This file may either contain both private key and certificate or you may
      specify --cert-key separately.

options.name: cert_key
options.title: cert_key
options.help:
--cert-key CERT_KEY
      The private key to use with SSL. Only needed if --cert is given and the
      certificate file does not contain the private key.

options.name: timeout
options.title: timeout
options.help:
--timeout SECONDS
      The connection timeout of the request in seconds. The default value is
      30 seconds

parameters.name: method
parameters.title: method
parameters.help:
METHOD
      The HTTP method to be used for the request (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, ...).

      This argument can be omitted in which case HTTPie will use POST if there
      is some data to be sent, otherwise GET:

parameters.name: url
parameters.title: url
parameters.help: HTTP URL to call RESTful API
